strings: <se_low>Yangus: I blame Rhapthorne for them boss trolls nearly eatin' the Chancellor's family, y'know.

<se_low>Yangus: I don't mean 'e ordered them or nuffin'.
Well, I don't think so anyway!

<se_low>Yangus: Nah, just that Rhapthorne's makin' all the monsters go a bit crazy, like.
Them trolls included.
<se_low>Yangus: Ain't this the Chancellor of Argonia's 'ouse?

<se_low>Yangus: Don't look like there's no one 'ere.
This'd be a dream come true for a thief lookin' to score!<page>Yangus: ...No need to look at me like that! I was only sayin'!

<se_low>Yangus: They must be loaded, livin' in a place like this.
I reckon they could afford to pay a debt easy.

<se_low>Yangus: So it won't 'urt for us to go lookin' for 'em, eh?
Sure there'll be somefin' in it for us.

<se_high>Jessica: Everything looks so normal on the surface.
The castle, the town, all of it. But dangerous things are happening behind the scenes.

<se_high>Jessica: It isn't just here. It's everywhere.
The only way to save the world from destruction is by defeating Rhapthorne.
<se_high>Jessica: The longer we take to beat Rhapthorne, the more the danger grows.
<se_high>Jessica: It's a little strange that we haven't seen a single maid in this huge mansion.

<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to be going to the mirror on the second floor? Remember?<page>Jessica: The one that connects to the labyrinth?
Where the Chancellor's being held prisoner?
Am I refreshing your memory?

<se_def>Angelo: So it's thanks to us that the Chancellor's safe again! He's the brains of Argonia, you know!<page>Angelo: What would've become of the kingdom if his treasured grey matter had been scoffed by trolls!?
<se_def>Angelo: I've a good mind to complain that we haven't received some kind of official thanks, but maybe that'd be pushing our luck.
<se_def>Angelo: It's very quiet.
<se_def>Angelo: Doesn't look like anyone's home...
<se_def>Angelo: If the Chancellor and his family have been taken off by monsters, I doubt they'll be able to escape without any help.
<se_def>Angelo: I won't be able to get any sleep tonight if we just leave them to die. I suppose we don't have any choice but to go and help them.
<se_low>Yangus: I blame Rhapthorne for them boss trolls nearly eatin' the Chancellor's family, y'know.

<se_low>Yangus: I don't mean 'e ordered them or nuffin'.
Well, I don't think so anyway!

<se_low>Yangus: Nah, just that Rhapthorne's makin' all the monsters go a bit crazy, like.
Them trolls included.
<se_low>Yangus: Ain't this the Chancellor of Argonia's 'ouse?

<se_low>Yangus: Don't look like there's no one 'ere.
This'd be a dream come true for a thief lookin' to score!<page>Yangus: ...No need to look at me like that! I was only sayin'!

<se_low>Yangus: They must be loaded, livin' in a place like this.
I reckon they could afford to pay a debt easy.

<se_low>Yangus: So it won't 'urt for us to go lookin' for 'em, eh?
Sure there'll be somefin' in it for us.

<se_high>Jessica: Everything looks so normal on the surface.
The castle, the town, all of it. But dangerous things are happening behind the scenes.

<se_high>Jessica: It isn't just here. It's everywhere.
The only way to save the world from destruction is by defeating Rhapthorne.
<se_high>Jessica: The longer we take to beat Rhapthorne, the more the danger grows.
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe anyone who owned a mansion like this would leave it totally unattended.
<se_high>Jessica: I mean, the front door wasn't even locked!

<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to be going to the mirror on the second floor? Remember?<page>Jessica: The one that connects to the labyrinth?
Where the Chancellor's being held prisoner?
Am I refreshing your memory?

<se_def>Angelo: So it's thanks to us that the Chancellor's safe again! He's the brains of Argonia, you know!<page>Angelo: What would've become of the kingdom if his treasured grey matter had been scoffed by trolls!?
<se_def>Angelo: I've a good mind to complain that we haven't received some kind of official thanks, but maybe that'd be pushing our luck.
<se_def>Angelo: I can't help feeling that this silence isn't just down to the fact that it's night-time.
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe we should go and have a look around inside.
<se_def>Angelo: If the Chancellor and his family have been taken off by monsters, I doubt they'll be able to escape without any help.
<se_def>Angelo: I won't be able to get any sleep tonight if we just leave them to die. I suppose we don't have any choice but to go and help them.
<se_low>Yangus: I'm always surprised at 'ow big Argonia is.
<se_low>Yangus: Huh! Orb-'untin' 'ere ain't gonna be no fun.
<se_high>Jessica: I don't recall any of the heirs to the great sages living in Argonia.
<se_high>Jessica: So I don't think we'll find an orb around here. But if you insist...
<se_def>Angelo: Once we've collected all the orbs, it'll be time to fight Rhapthorne.
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe we should get whatever we might need in battle while we're looking for them?
<se_high>Red: Seems like that mirror's only started glowin' pretty recently. S'pose it's summat to do wiv Rhapthorne, eh?
<se_high>Red: So...there's no one in the big old place. This 'ole fancy 'ouse, totally unguarded. ...Heh heh, int'restin' thought.
<se_high>Red: It's a bit 'ard to be bothered, but I s'pose we better go an' rescue 'em, eh? Ya know, fate an' karma an' all that.
<se_high>Red: We're talkin' about the Chancellor of one o' the biggest and fanciest kingdoms in the world, right? There's gotta be an 'andsome reward if we save 'im, surely.
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, the mirror, it still leads to the boss troll's place, ay? Even now, after we have defeated them already.
<se_low>Morrie: Then we have the perfetto place to practise the combattente. Just we must take a care we are not <endash> How do you say? <endash> ‘stewing their juices’, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Entering and breaking the house when no one is there, it's not the done thingies, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: When we take the peek in the shining mirror upstairs in the middle of the night, that must take us to the place where the Chancellor is.
<se_low>Morrie: If we are waiting longer, the Chancellor and his famiglia, they're gonna be toast, ay? Dinner for the monsters!
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, the mirror, it still leads to the boss troll's place, ay? Even now, after we have defeated them already.
<se_low>Morrie: Then we have the perfetto place to practise the combattente. Just we must take a care we are not <endash> How do you say? <endash> ‘stewing their juices’, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Entering and breaking the house when no one is there, it's not the done thingies, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: It is too quiet here, ay? I smell something is up a rat! Come, maybe we find a clue somewhere in the house, si?
<se_low>Morrie: When we take the peek in the shining mirror upstairs in the middle of the night, that must take us to the place where the Chancellor is.
<se_low>Morrie: If we are waiting longer, the Chancellor and his famiglia, they're gonna be toast, ay? Dinner for the monsters!
